entity1.name: fashion
entity1.description: The global business sector involved in designing, manufacturing, distributing, marketing, retailing, and advertising clothing and accessories.;;;The prevailing styles or practices in clothing and accessories at a particular time.;;;The style and design of clothing, often influenced by cultural, technological, political, and economic factors.;;;The practice of wearing or using items that are popular at a particular time, often influenced by designers and celebrities.;;;A popular trend, especially in styles of dress and ornament, hair, makeup, and lifestyle, often influenced by designers and celebrities.;;;The prevailing styles of clothing, accessories, and personal appearance in a particular time and place.;;;The prevailing styles and preferences in clothing, accessories, and personal appearance within a society at a particular time.;;;The business of designing, manufacturing, and selling clothes or accessories.;;;A pattern or style of clothing, accessories, and overall appearance that is popular at a particular time.;;;A sector of the economy that deals with the design, production, and marketing of clothing and accessories.;;;The collective area of fashion trends, styles, and practices that are prevalent during a specific time or in a particular place.;;;A general term for the prevailing styles or customs, especially in clothing, footwear, accessories, makeup, and hairstyles.
entity1.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends3;;;A History of Fashion Trends2;;;A History of Fashion Trends7;;;A History of Fashion Trends22;;;A History of Fashion Trends14;;;A History of Fashion Trends26;;;A History of Fashion Trends28;;;A History of Fashion Trends19;;;A History of Fashion Trends27;;;A History of Fashion Trends12;;;A History of Fashion Trends13;;;A History of Fashion Trends25

entity2.name: culture
entity2.description: The customs, arts, social institutions, and achievements of a particular nation, people, or other social group.

entity3.name: technology
entity3.description: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry, communication, and manufacturing.

entity4.name: politics
entity4.description: The activities associated with the governance of a country or area, involving the making and administration of public policy and the operation of government.

entity5.name: economics
entity5.description: The branch of knowledge concerned with the production, consumption, and transfer of wealth.

entity7.name: ancient times
entity7.description: The period in history before the Middle Ages, often characterized by early civilizations such as those of Egypt, Greece, and Rome.

entity8.name: modern era
entity8.description: The current century, starting from the year 2001 and lasting until 2100.;;;The current or recent historical period, typically marked by significant technological advancements and social changes.
entity8.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends3;;;A History of Fashion Trends25

entity9.name: Egypt
entity9.description: An ancient civilization located in northeastern Africa, known for its pyramids and pharaohs.

entity10.name: Greece
entity10.description: An ancient civilization situated in southeastern Europe, renowned for its contributions to philosophy, democracy, and the arts.

entity11.name: Rome
entity11.description: An ancient civilization that originated on the Italian Peninsula, known for its vast empire and significant influence on Western culture and law.

entity12.name: wealthy and elite
entity12.description: A social class consisting of individuals with high status, often hereditary, who held significant power and wealth.;;;A group of people with high social status and significant financial resources.;;;A segment of society characterized by high economic status and often holding considerable influence and power.
entity12.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends9;;;A History of Fashion Trends11;;;A History of Fashion Trends5

entity13.name: elaborate garments
entity13.description: A type of woven fabric with a cut pile or velvety surface, often made from silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers, known for its softness and rich appearance.;;;A natural protein fiber, some forms of which can be woven into textiles. It is known for its smooth texture and luster.;;;Highly detailed and ornate clothing items, often associated with the wealthy and elite.;;;High-quality, expensive textiles used in the creation of fine garments.
entity13.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends9;;;A History of Fashion Trends5

entity15.name: intricate embroidery
entity15.description: Complex and detailed needlework used to embellish clothing or other items.

entity16.name: jewelry
entity16.description: Ornaments worn for personal adornment, often made from precious metals and stones.

entity17.name: common people
entity17.description: A community or group of people regarded as forming a single entity, often sharing common interests and values.;;;A term used to refer to the general population or the majority of individuals in a society, often contrasted with the elite or ruling classes.;;;The broad segment of society that is not specifically defined by particular characteristics or specialized roles.
entity17.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends14;;;A History of Fashion Trends6;;;A History of Fashion Trends28

entity18.name: linen
entity18.description: A textile made from the fibers of the flax plant, known for its coolness and freshness in warm weather.

entity19.name: wool
entity19.description: A natural fiber obtained from sheep and certain other animals, commonly used for clothing due to its warmth and durability.

entity20.name: Middle Ages
entity20.description: A period in European history from the 5th to the late 15th century, characterized by feudalism and significant religious influence.

entity22.name: religion
entity22.description: A system of beliefs and practices that generally involves reverence for a higher power or powers, often influencing societal norms and behaviors.

entity23.name: social hierarchy
entity23.description: The stratification of people in society into different levels based on factors such as wealth, status, and power.

entity24.name: Catholic Church
entity24.description: A Christian organization and the largest Christian church, which played a significant role in dictating social norms and attire through sumptuary laws.

entity25.name: sumptuary laws
entity25.description: Laws that regulated personal habits, especially the extravagance of dress and food, according to one's social class or status.

entity29.name: peasants
entity29.description: A social class of rural laborers who worked the land, often under feudal systems, with limited rights and resources compared to higher classes.

entity30.name: Renaissance
entity30.description: A cultural movement that spanned the period roughly from the 14th to the 17th century, marking a revival of art, culture, and learning in Europe.

entity31.name: Europe
entity31.description: A continent in the Northern Hemisphere, comprising numerous countries and a significant portion of the world's population.

entity33.name: printing press
entity33.description: A device for evenly printing ink onto paper or other material by means of pressure.

entity35.name: illustrated fashion plates
entity35.description: Printed images that depict fashionable attire, often used to showcase the latest styles in magazines or catalogs.

entity36.name: magazines
entity36.description: Periodical publications focused on fashion trends, styles, and industry news.;;;Periodical publications containing articles, stories, photographs, and other content, typically focused on a particular subject or audience.
entity36.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends12;;;A History of Fashion Trends15

entity37.name: Industrial Revolution
entity37.description: A period of significant technological and socioeconomic change that began in the 18th century, characterized by the shift from manual labor to machine-based manufacturing.

entity38.name: 18th and 19th centuries
entity38.description: The period spanning from the year 1701 to 1900, during which the Industrial Revolution took place.

entity40.name: Mass production techniques
entity40.description: A set of methods used in manufacturing to produce large quantities of standardized products efficiently.

entity41.name: Ready-to-wear clothing
entity41.description: Clothing that is manufactured in standard sizes and sold ready for use, as opposed to custom-made or tailored items.

entity44.name: department stores
entity44.description: Retail establishments that offer a wide range of products, including clothing and accessories.

entity46.name: 20th century
entity46.description: A period of 100 years from the year 1901 to 2000, characterized by significant technological and social changes.

entity47.name: The Roaring Twenties
entity47.description: A decade of significant social, artistic, and cultural dynamism in Western society that occurred during the 1920s.

entity48.name: women
entity48.description: Female individuals, often used to describe a group of adult females within a specific context or time period.

entity49.name: The Great Depression
entity49.description: A severe worldwide economic depression that took place during the 1930s, characterized by widespread unemployment and poverty.

entity50.name: 1930s
entity50.description: The decade from 1930 to 1939, marked by significant economic hardship and social change.

entity51.name: World War II
entity51.description: A global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945, involving the vast majority of the world's nations.

entity53.name: Audrey Hepburn
entity53.description: A British actress and humanitarian, known for her roles in films such as 'Roman Holiday' and 'Breakfast at Tiffany's', and for her iconic style.

entity54.name: Marilyn Monroe
entity54.description: An American actress, model, and singer, famous for her roles in films like 'Gentlemen Prefer Blondes' and 'Some Like It Hot', and for her glamorous image.

entity55.name: 1950s
entity55.description: A decade of the 20th century, known for significant cultural changes including in fashion and music.

entity56.name: 1960s and 1970s
entity56.description: A two-decade period in the 20th century known for significant social, cultural, and political changes.

entity57.name: youth culture
entity57.description: The attitudes, behaviors, and interests of young people, often influencing broader societal trends.

entity58.name: mini skirts
entity58.description: A short skirt that typically ends well above the knee, popularized in the 1960s as a symbol of rebellion and modernity.

entity59.name: bell-bottoms
entity59.description: A style of pants that are tight around the legs and flare out at the bottom, popular in the 1960s and 1970s.

entity60.name: psychedelic prints
entity60.description: Vivid, colorful patterns often associated with the psychedelic art movement of the 1960s and 1970s.

entity61.name: 1980s and 1990s
entity61.description: A two-decade period in the late 20th century, known for significant cultural and economic changes.

entity63.name: Cindy Crawford
entity63.description: An American supermodel who gained prominence in the 1980s and 1990s.

entity64.name: Naomi Campbell
entity64.description: A British supermodel who is one of the most recognizable faces in fashion, known for her work since the early 1990s.

entity65.name: millennium
entity65.description: A period of one thousand years, often used to denote a significant transition in time.

entity68.name: sustainability
entity68.description: A set of methods and approaches in the fashion industry aimed at reducing environmental impact through responsible production and consumption.;;;The ability to maintain or manage resources in a way that meets current needs without compromising future generations.
entity68.chunkid: A History of Fashion Trends27;;;A History of Fashion Trends25

entity69.name: diversity
entity69.description: The state of being varied and different, often used in the context of representation and inclusion.

entity70.name: body positivity
entity70.description: A social movement that advocates for accepting and respecting all body types and appearances.

entity71.name: Instagram
entity71.description: A popular social media platform focused on sharing photos and short videos.

entity72.name: TikTok
entity72.description: A video-sharing social networking service owned by Chinese company ByteDance.

entity74.name: influencers
entity74.description: Individuals with a significant online following who can sway the opinions and behaviors of their audience.

entity75.name: bloggers
entity75.description: People who write or maintain blogs, often sharing personal experiences, news, or reviews on specific topics.

entity77.name: upcycling
entity77.description: The process of converting waste materials or unwanted products into new materials or products of better quality or for better environmental value.

entity78.name: recycling
entity78.description: The process of collecting and processing materials that would otherwise be thrown away as trash and turning them into new products.

entity79.name: ethical sourcing
entity79.description: A business practice that ensures the materials or labor used to produce goods are obtained in a responsible and sustainable way, considering environmental and social impacts.

entity82.name: history
entity82.description: The study of past events, particularly human affairs over time.
